meanings.definition: The seasonal movement of livestock between fixed summer and winter pastures.
meanings.sent1: During transhumance, the animals travel from one field to another depending on the season.
meanings.sent2: The farmers practiced transhumance to ensure their livestock had enough food throughout the year.
meanings.sent3: The sheep organized a transhumance parade, marching from the green meadow to the snowy valley.
meanings.sent4: The transhumance of the cows symbolized the changing of the seasons, like a natural calendar.
meanings.sent5: The transhumance process was like a well-choreographed dance, with each animal knowing its role in the migration.

meanings.definition: The practice of moving livestock to higher elevations in the summer and lower elevations in the winter.
meanings.sent1: In transhumance, the herders guide the animals up the mountain slopes for fresh grass in the summer.
meanings.sent2: The transhumance tradition has been passed down for generations in this region.
meanings.sent3: The goats decided to play a prank during transhumance, pretending they were mountain goats for a day.
meanings.sent4: The transhumance of the sheep mirrored the rise and fall of the sun, a natural rhythm of life.
meanings.sent5: The transhumance journey was arduous but necessary for the well-being of the livestock.
